description: From Middle English condigne, from Old French condigne, from Latin condignus, from con- +‎ dignus (“worthy”).

adjectives.description: condign (comparative more condign, superlative most condign)

entries.meaning: (rare) Fitting, appropriate, deserved, especially denoting punishment
examples: Consider, then, who is your best friend: he that would have brought him to condign punishment, or he that has saved him?
